message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.NE 

This paper deals with natural language processing (NLP) and specifically focuses on the task of modeling the structure of coherent texts. The paper proposes an end-to-end unsupervised deep learning approach based on the set-to-sequence framework to address this problem. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category for this paper is cs.CL (Computation and Language). 

The paper also uses recurrent neural networks (RNNs) for modeling the coherence of texts, which is a common technique in machine learning and falls under the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning). 

The paper also discusses the use of deep learning techniques for NLP, which is a sub-field of artificial intelligence (AI) and falls under the sub-category of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). 

The paper also evaluates the performance of their proposed model on tasks such as sentence similarity and paraphrase detection, which are common information retrieval tasks and fall under the sub-category of cs.IR (Information Retrieval). 

Finally, the paper uses neural networks to learn useful text representations, which is a sub-field of neural engineering and falls under the sub-category of cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing).
